description: From Old French chevrele, diminutive form of chèvre (“goat”).

adjectives.description: cheverel (comparative more cheverel, superlative most cheverel)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Pliable as kid leather; elastic, flexible, usually with reference to someone's conscience.
examples: Now were there any one of so tender or cheverell a conscience, to whome no cure might seeme worthy of so extreame a remedy, I should prise or regard him no whit the lesse.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Kid, as used to make leather.
